description: Dashboard for overview of services running within Zerops.io

panels.description: CPU scaling limits for containers in this service.
panels.title: CPU [Min / Max]

panels.description: RAM scaling limits for containers in this service.
panels.title: RAM [Min / Max]

panels.description: Disk scaling limits for containers in this service.
panels.title: Disk [Min. / Max.]

panels.description: Max set to 2 instead of 1, so graph stays below the value name.
panels.title: CPU mode

panels.description:
Total CPU cores granted and utilized across all containers in this service.

Theoretical maximum: `CPU scaling limit × max containers`. Values may temporarily exceed this maximum during zero-downtime deployments.
panels.title: CPU [Granted / Utilized]

panels.description:
Total RAM granted and utilized across all containers in this service.

Theoretical maximum: `RAM scaling limit × max containers`. Values may temporarily exceed this maximum during zero-downtime deployments.
panels.title: RAM [Granted / Utilized]

panels.description:
Total Disk granted and utilized across all containers in this service.

Theoretical maximum: `Disk scaling limit × max containers`. Values may temporarily exceed this maximum during zero-downtime deployments.
panels.title: Disk [Granted / Utilized]

panels.description:
Container scaling boundaries and current count for this service.

Shows minimum, maximum, and current container counts based on scaling configuration.
Current count may temporarily exceed this maximum during zero-downtime deployments.
panels.title: Container counts

list.description:
Select which Zerops project to display (only relevant for central Prometheus setups). 
Uses project ID since project names can change.
list.name: projectId

list.description: Select a specific region (applies only to multi-region projects).
list.name: region

list.description:
Select a specific region (applies only to multi-region projects).
Projects are global; instances are region-specific within project.
list.name: instanceId

list.description: Use this variable instead of `serviceStack` if you do not want to see `build` or `prepare` stacks/containers. Delete `serviceStack` variable and rename this one to `serviceStack`.
list.name: serviceStackAlt

list.description: Select the correct service stack ID when multiple stacks share the same name (from deletion/recreation).
list.name: serviceStackId

list.description: Select a specific service within the stack. Some stacks contain multiple services (e.g., HA databases include both DB and proxy services).
list.name: service

title: Service Metrics
